name: EVMTransaction
description:
The purpose of this type is to relay transactions from an evm chain to FLARE chain.
 This type is only relevant for the evm-compatible chains.
verification:
If transaction with `transactionId` is contained a block on main branch with at least `requiredConfirmations`, the specified data is relayed.
 If an indicated event does not exist, the request is rejected.

requestBody.name: RequestBody
requestBody.description: Request body for EVM transaction attestation type
requestBody.below:
Note that events (logs) are indexed in block not in each transaction. The contract that uses the attestation should specify the order of event logs as needed and the requestor should sort `logIndices`
 with respect to the set specifications. If possible, the contact should only require one `logIndex`.

params.name: transactionHash
params.comment: Hash of the transaction(transactionHash).

params.name: requiredConfirmations
params.comment: The height at which a block is considered confirmed by the requestor.

params.name: provideInput
params.comment: If true, "input" field is included in the response.

params.name: listEvents
params.comment: If true, events indicated by `logIndices` are included in the response. Otherwise, no events are included in the response.

params.name: logIndices
params.comment: If listEvents is false, this should be an empty list, otherwise, the request is rejected. If listEvents is true, this is the list of indices (logIndex) of the events to be relayed (sorted by the requestor). The array should contain at most 50 indices. If empty, it indicates all events in order capped by 50.

responseBody.name: ResponseBody
responseBody.description: Response body for EVM transaction attestation type

params.name: blockNumber
params.comment: Number of the block in which the transaction is included.

params.name: timestamp
params.comment: Timestamp of the block in which the transaction is included.

params.name: sourceAddress
params.comment: The address (from) that signed the transaction.

params.name: isDeployment
params.comment: Indicate whether it is a contract creation transaction.

params.name: receivingAddress
params.comment: The address (to) of the receiver of the initial transaction. Zero address if `isDeployment` is true.

params.name: value
params.comment: The value transferred by the initial transaction in wei.

params.name: input
params.comment: If `provideInput`, this is the data send along with the initial transaction. Otherwise it is the default value `0x00`.

params.name: status
params.comment: Status of the transaction 1 - success, 0 - failure.

params.name: events
params.comment: If `listEvents` is true, an array of the requested events. Sorted by the logIndex in the same order as `logIndices`. Otherwise, an empty array.

responseStructs.name: Event
responseStructs.above: An `Event` is a struct with the following fields:
responseStructs.below: For additional description of event log, see [here](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/#eth_getfilterchanges).

params.name: logIndex
params.comment: The consecutive number of the event in block.

params.name: emitterAddress
params.comment: The address of the contract that emitted the event.

params.name: topics
params.comment: An array of up to 4 32-byte strings of indexed log arguments. The first string is the signature of the event.

params.name: data
params.comment: Concatenated 32-byte strings of non-indexed log arguments. At least 32 bytes long.

params.name: removed
params.comment: It is true if log was removed due to a chain reorganization and false if it is a valid log.
